meanings.definition: Not guided by or based on good sense; irrational.
meanings.sent1: Her decision to wear a winter coat in the scorching summer heat was an unreasonableness choice.
meanings.sent2: The teacher found the student's unreasonableness behavior disruptive to the class.
meanings.sent3: It was quite an unreasonableness idea to try to fit a watermelon into a small lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: The unreasonableness demands of the spoiled child left the parents feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The unreasonableness request for a raise without any justification was quickly denied.

meanings.definition: Exceeding the limits of reason or moderation; excessive.
meanings.sent1: The unreasonableness amount of candy he ate made him feel sick.
meanings.sent2: Her unreasonableness spending habits left her with a mountain of debt.
meanings.sent3: The unreasonableness number of balloons in the room made it hard to see the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: The unreasonableness noise coming from the party next door kept us awake all night.
meanings.sent5: The unreasonableness length of the meeting made everyone restless and eager to leave.

meanings.definition: Not in accordance with practical realities or the facts; impractical.
meanings.sent1: His unreasonableness plan to build a castle made of ice in the desert was doomed to fail.
meanings.sent2: The unreasonableness idea of traveling to Mars without any training seemed absurd.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit an elephant into a small car would be an unreasonableness task.
meanings.sent4: The unreasonableness belief that pigs could fly led to many failed experiments.
meanings.sent5: The unreasonableness suggestion to swim across the ocean was quickly dismissed as impossible.
